meanings.definition: The organ of hearing and balance in humans and other vertebrates, especially the external part of this organ.
meanings.sent1: She covered her ears to block out the loud noise.
meanings.sent2: He gently cleaned his ears with a cotton swab.
meanings.sent3: The cat's ears perked up when it heard the sound of a can opener.
meanings.sent4: The ears of the old house seemed to listen to the stories whispered within its walls.
meanings.sent5: The rabbit's long ears twitched at the slightest rustle in the bushes.

meanings.sent1: His keen ear could detect even the faintest of sounds.
meanings.sent2: She lost her ear for music after the accident.
meanings.sent3: The ear of the detective caught the subtle click of the lock.
meanings.sent4: The ear of the town gossip never missed a juicy piece of news.
meanings.sent5: The ear of the owl allowed it to hunt silently in the night.

meanings.sent1: The ear of the newborn baby was still developing.
meanings.sent2: His ear for accents made him a great mimic.
meanings.sent3: The ear of the robot was programmed to recognize specific commands.
meanings.sent4: The ear of the scientist picked up the faint signal from space.
meanings.sent5: The ear of the musician could distinguish between different instruments in an orchestra.
